intro: Bupleurum canescens var. handiense, commonly known as the hairy bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine, hairy textures, contributing to its common name. This species is often found in rocky or arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
